business.headline: Reliance sees worst session since June 2024. What should investors do now?Reliance Industries shares closed 4.5% lower at Rs 1,507.6, marking their steepest decline since June 4, 2024. During the session, the stock slipped as much as 5.1% to Rs 1,496.30, hitting its lowest level since November 11, as selling pressure intensified.
Sensex ends 376 points lower, Nifty below 26,200; RIL tanks 4%The S&P BSE Sensex declined 376.28 points to close at 85,063.34, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 71.60 points to end at 26,178.70.

Tata Steel, JSW Steel and SAIL found in breach of antitrust laws: ReportThe Competition Commission of India has also held 56 top executives liable for price collusion over different periods between 2015 and 2023.

Why US–Venezuela tensions have global markets watching oil and goldTensions between the US and Venezuela are worrying markets because oil supplies and economic stability could be affected if the situation worsens. Here's all you need to know.

Reliance share price crashes 5%: Is it good time to buy the stock?RIL share price: The stock opened slightly lower at Rs 1,575.55 and remained under selling pressure through the session. At the time of writing, the share price was at Rs 1,509, down Rs 68.45 or 4.34%.

Is Venezuela the trigger, or is gold and silver's rally bigger than geopolitics?In India, MCX gold is trading at a lifetime high. A decisive breakout could push prices sharply higher, while lower levels continue to attract buyers rather than panic sellers. MCX silver, trading over Rs 2.5 lakh, remains in an uptrend as long as key support zones hold.

Cupid share price rebounds sharply, up 9% today. Here's whyThe rebound follows a brutal sell-off on Monday, when the stock plunged nearly 20% after a large block deal weighed on sentiment and triggered aggressive profit-booking.

HDFC Bank share price falls over 2% after Q3 business updateHDFC Bank shares were among the top drags on benchmark indices as selling pressure intensified, even as the broader market traded lower in early deals.

Reliance share price down over 4%. Why is it falling today?The fall in Reliance shares comes against the backdrop of a broader market correction. Both the Sensex and the Nifty traded lower in early deals as investors turned cautious on global cues and reduced exposure to heavyweight stocks.

Trent shares fall 8%: Why is the stock falling today, and should you buy?Trent share price: The stock opened lower at Rs 4,219.90 and slipped further to an intraday low of Rs 4,060.65, close to its 52-week low of Rs 3,931.45.
Sensex opens 150 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; RIL down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 238.67 points to 85,200.95, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 57.15 points to 26,193.15 as of 9:22 am.

Reliance Industries denies report on Russian oil deliveries to Jamnagar refineryReliance clarified that its Jamnagar refinery has not received any cargo of Russian oil in the past three weeks. The company also said it is not expecting any deliveries of Russian crude oil in January.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO: Price band out, does GMP point to 50% listing gains?Bharat Coking Coal IPO is a book-built issue of Rs 1,071.11 crore. The entire issue is an offer for sale of 46.57 crore shares, with no fresh issue component.

US plans talks with oil companies on boosting Venezuela output after Maduro ousterThe meetings are crucial to the administration's hopes of getting top US oil companies back into the South American nation after its government, nearly two decades ago, took control of US-led energy operations there.
Sensex closes 322 points lower, Nifty below 26,300; Infosys down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 322.39 points to close at 85,439.62, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 78.25 points to end at 26,250.30.

What worries RBI about India's insurance sector despite its stability?The RBI highlights that the insurance sector is systemically important because of its size, its role as a long-term investor, and its growing links with the wider financial system.

How investors can manage short-term uncertainty with digital gold, ETFs and SGBsFrom an investment perspective, buying physical gold may no longer be the most efficient choice. When purchasing physical gold, investors must pay 3% GST upfront, which immediately impacts returns.

Gold prices rise again as US–Venezuela tensions flare. Buy now or wait?Market participants say the latest geopolitical flare-up has reinforced gold's role as a hedge against uncertainty, at a time when investors are already navigating an uneasy global backdrop.

Mis-selling complaints are rising. Here's what IRDAI's latest report showsData in the IRDAI Annual Report 2024–25 shows that grievances categorised under Unfair Business Practices increased to 26,667 in FY25, up from 23,335 in FY24, a rise of around 14% year-on-year.

US action on Venezuela's oil: Is there an opportunity for India?Indian oil refiners and upstream companies could still find opportunities if Venezuelan crude re-enters global markets and long-pending investments and payments are unlocked.

entertainment.headline: Watch: Hardik Pandya introduces his girlfriend Mahieka Sharma to Amitabh Bachchan Cricketer Hardik Pandya's introduction of his model girlfriend Mahieka Sharma to Amitabh Bachchan during a Mumbai event has captured widespread attention online.

The Judge Returns review: Ji Sung's legal drama tests patience early onRelease Date:Thu Jan 02, 2025 The Judge Returns follows a judge who wakes up ten years in the past to correct his mistakes. The series blends political corruption with a time-reset twist but struggles with pacing and tone.

I don't know Kartik, says Karina Kubiliute's Insta bio after Kartik Aaryan link-up Amid rumours that she is dating Kartik Aaryan after photos from the actor's Goa trip went viral, Karina Kubiliute has updated her Instagram bio to deny knowing him.

Avengers Doomsday teaser: X-Men take centre stage in fourth preview Marvel Studios released the fourth teaser for Avengers: Doomsday on Tuesday. It gave fans their first look at the X-Men's integration into the Marvel Cinematic Universe and promised significant crossover moments.

Jack Black says rejecting The Incredibles is his biggest career regret Actor Jack Black has said that he regrets turning down 'The Incredibles' (2004) and calling it one of his favourite films. He will next be seen in 'The Super Mario Galaxy Movie' (2026).

Jeethu Joseph's Drishyam 3 to release in April, ahead of Ajay Devgn's Hindi version Director Jeethu Joseph confirmed the release of his crime-thriller 'Drishyam 3' in April 2026. The film features Mohanlal in the lead role.

Bigg Boss 19 reunion in Dubai: Gaurav, Ashnoor, Awez party as Amaal, Farrhana skip Contestants from Bigg Boss 19, including winner Gaurav Khanna, gathered in Dubai for a reunion party weeks after the show's finale. Meanwhile, Amaal Mallik and Farrhana Bhatt skipped the gathering.

Yami Gautam thanks fans as Haq gets positive response on OTT Yami Gautam Dhar expressed gratitude to fans after Haq received a positive response following its OTT release on Netflix. The film, which also stars Emraan Hashmi, explores themes of gender, justice and women's rights.

Dhurandhar 2 to have another Flipperachi song? Fa9la singer replies Fa9la by Flipperachi became an instant hit following Akshaye Khanna's entry in Dhurandhar. The singer has now hinted in an exclusive conversation that the song may feature in Dhurandhar 2 as well.

Diljit Dosanjh birthday: Sonam Bajwa, Imtiaz Ali, Suniel Shetty extend wishes Several Bollywood celebrities extended heartfelt birthday greetings to Diljit Dosanjh as he turned a year older on January 6. His upcoming Bollywood film Border 2, featuring an ensemble cast including Sunny Deol, Varun Dhawan and Ahan Shetty, is set for a Republic Day release.

Akshay-Katrina's Tees Maar Khan has become Gen Z favourite, says Farah Khan Farah Khan's Tees Maar Khan has grown into a cult favourite over the years, especially among Gen Z audiences, despite its initial box office failure.

Kartik Aaryan's Goa pic goes viral, internet points to 'mystery girl' Actor Kartik Aaryan has reportedly become the subject of fresh online speculation after picture from his recent Goa vacation surfaced on social media platforms, particularly Reddit.

Space Gen: Chandrayaan to tell the story of India's lunar mission. Watch teaser JioHotstar announces Space Gen: Chandrayaan, a series based on Chandrayaan-2 mission. The show highlights the emotional resilience of scientists after the lunar mission setback.

Sunny Deol fans are there too: Varun Dhawan to Pak viewer curious about Border 2 Varun Dhawan acknowledged Sunny Deol's popularity across borders after responding to a fan from Pakistan during a live interaction on X. The exchange comes ahead of the release of Border 2, which revisits the 1971 war.

Yash birthday celebrations hit new high; fans take over Bengaluru Metro KGF star Yash's birthday celebrations are getting bigger as the day draws closer in Bengaluru, with fans now having taken over the metro in the city.

Mohit Suri, Aditya Roy dismiss reunion rumours after Saiyaara: No film together Mohit Suri and Aditya Roy Kapur have denied reports of working together on a new film, calling the rumours baseless. Both clarified that there have been no discussions and that they only meet socially, not for work.

Chitrangda Singh would love to play Smita Patil in biopic: It would be incredible Actor Chitrangda Singh expresses her keen interest in portraying the legendary Smita Patil in a biopic, highlighting the special connection felt due to frequent comparisons.

AR Rahman turns 59: Ram Charan, Namit Malhotra share birthday wishes As AR Rahman celebrated his 59th birthday on January 6, wishes poured in from the film fraternity. His upcoming projects Ramayana and Peddi promise to showcase his musical brilliance once again.

Vir Das shares how Imran Khan offered to work in Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos Happy Patel: Khatarnak Jasoos has Aamir Khan as a producer. The film has a cast that includes Imran Khan, Vir Das and Sanjay Dutt, with Aamir in a cameo, and is set for release on January 16, 2026.

general news.headline: PM Modi not happy with me over steep tariffs: Trump on strain with IndiaDonald Trump noted the strain in ties while insisting that India has sharply cut back its oil imports from Russia. He said Prime Minister Modi was not happy because India is now "paying a lot of tariffs" as a result of US policy.

Universities can't be hate labs: JNU to act against students for anti-Modi chantsThe JNU administration further warned students that it would not tolerate any "form of violence, unlawful conduct or anti-national activity." Reacting to the development, the university said that, depending on the gravity of the offence, those involved would face immediate suspension, expulsion, or permanent debarment from the university.

Trump unpopular, unlike Modi: Ian Bremmer says US President's actions can be undoneGeopolitical expert Ian Bremmer noted that, unlike India - where PM Modi has ruled for 10 years and counting due to his popularity - Trump's tenure is limited. On Venezuela, he warned that Trump's successor could undo much of what he has done, just as Trump did with his predecessor.

Closer look at new Chinese structures near Pangong Lake and what they meanHigh-resolution satellite imagery shows the permanent nature of new Chinese structures coming up close to the Pangong Tso buffer zone.
Mahindra XUV 3XO EV launched, price starts from Rs 13.89 lakhThere's a brand new electric SUV from Mahindra, and it's called the XUV 3XO. Prices start at Rs 13.89 lakh (ex-showroom).

Venezuela op short-term win for Trump, will hurt US in long run: Ian BremmerIn an interview with India Today TV, geopolitical expert Ian Bremmer said the January 3 raid in Caracas reflects what he calls a "G-Zero world" and the United States "walking away from its own previous global order."

After IPL snub, Mustafizur Rahman unfazed by India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup sagaAfter his controversial IPL snub, Mustafizur Rahman appears to be unfazed by all the noise surrounding the India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup row. Bangladesh have refused to send their team to India for the upcoming ICC event.

Intense cold wave from today, dense fog to return across north IndiaA sharp deterioration in winter conditions is expected across large parts of India on January 7, with northern plains bracing for biting cold and falling temperatures. Widespread cold day conditions, dense to very dense fog and further drops in minimum temperatures are expected across Punjab, Haryana, Rajasthan and Delhi through mid-January.

Bus ride from London to Calcutta for £145: The 110-day route that once existedLondon to Calcutta, or vice versa, the bus service that operated in the 1960s and 70s offered passengers an unforgettable journey across multiple countries and continents. The 110-day route eventually came to an end due to growing instability in the Middle East.

US raid killed 55 Venezuelan and Cuban troops during Maduro capture, military saysVenezuela confirmed its first military losses after Maduro's capture, while Cuba detailed fallen personnel and regional leaders urged restraint, amid political uncertainty and rising scrutiny of the US-led intervention.

I will be impeached if Republicans don't win 2026 midterms: Donald TrumpFollowing the capture of Nicolas Maduro, calls for Trump's impeachment have turned shriller, with Democratic lawmakers and political figures stepping up demands for action.

SIR notice to Amartya Sen, claims Abhishek Banerjee; Election Commission respondsAlready pointing to SIR notices sent to Indian pacer Mohammed Shami and actor-politician Dev, Abhishek Banerjee alleged that even the Nobel-winning economist has been summoned before the poll body, calling the development "sad."

Don't want views, just want to...: Bihar's Russian girl on why going viral ruined her lifeWhat began as a light-hearted attempt to promote her litti-chicken stall in Ranchi spiralled into unwanted fame, forcing her to shut down the business. Now, she says she wants no views or virality, only the chance to work and live in peace.

Will Trump kidnap our PM? Congress leader's remark on Venezuela crisis sparks rowCongress leader Prithviraj Chavan drew the BJP's ire after likening India to Venezuela, asking whether US President Donald Trump would "kidnap" Prime Minister Narendra Modi as he did Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro.

How Maduro's arrest has spooked Khamenei regime in IranFollowing Nicolas Maduro's capture by the Donald Trump-led US, several reports of Washington-Jerusalem contingency planning have surfaced. The capture of the Venezuelan President has rattled Tehran amid widespread anti-Ayatollah protests in over 200 locations across Iran. With slogans openly targeting Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, mounting deaths and arrests, officials in the Ayatollah's regime fear that they could be the next victim of what they call Trump's aggressive foreign policy.

DMK's 32-seat offer pushes Tamil Nadu Congress to pitch TVK tie-up to Rahul GandhiAhead of the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly polls, Congress power-sharing talks within the DMK alliance have triggered fresh seat negotiations. Congress sees 40 seats as ideal, DMK is ready with 32, while Congress has lowered its ask to 38.

Kartik Aaryan's Goa pic goes viral, internet points to 'mystery girl'Actor Kartik Aaryan has reportedly become the subject of fresh online speculation after picture from his recent Goa vacation surfaced on social media platforms, particularly Reddit.

Isro's Anvesha satellite to launch on PSLV-C62 to space on January 12The launch will mark the 64th flight of the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV) and the 5th use of the PSLV-DL variant, equipped with two strap-on boosters.
No one's talking about the price one pays for casual sexCasual sex can feel liberating, until it doesn't. Experts unpack what often goes unsaid.

How a wet towel drove Manipur woman to stab her South Korean partner to deathDuring the interrogation, it was revealed that the dispute between the victim, Duck Jee Yuh, and the woman started over a wet towel. Duck's towel was wet, which angered him. He also verbally abused the accused. The argument escalated to the point that the woman attacked him with a kitchen knife.

Your house can be lifted like a car. Here's how it actually worksIf your house is sinking, flooding, or coming in the way of a road, there is a solution that does not involve demolition. Across Indian cities, people are now lifting and even shifting entire houses using heavy-duty jacks.

It is Over: Why a deleted article on Gen Z has taken Pakistan by stormAn op-ed written by a Pakistani PhD student in the US, Zorain Nizamani, the son of an actor couple, on the growing disconnect between Pakistan's ruling elite and Gen Z has grabbed the attention of global media and social platforms. The article was taken down within hours, apparently on the orders of the army, generating a storm in Pakistan.

Real-life Bala in Greater Noida, wig hides baldness, groom faces troubleA young woman has accused her husband of pulling off the ultimate "hair-raising" deception. Before marriage, the groom allegedly ensured everything about him looked perfectly normal, especially his hair. The trick? A carefully placed wig that convincingly masked his baldness. Remember a movie on this theme? Read here to know the bald secret..

Experts slam Zomato CEO's temple device as scientifically unsupportedAn AIIMS doctor and TheLiverDoc criticised Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal's Temple brain-flow wearable, calling it scientifically unsupported and warned people not to waste money on unproven health gadgets claiming to measure cerebral blood flow.

sports.headline: Historic 1st as SG Pipers opt to field 9 Indian stars in Women's Hockey India League In a historic first in the Women's Hockey India League, the SG Pipers named nine Indian players in their starting XI for the clash against Shrachi Bengal Tigers on Tuesday, January 6. The Pipers went down fighting in the game in a sudden-death shootout.

After IPL snub, Mustafizur Rahman unfazed by India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup saga After his controversial IPL snub, Mustafizur Rahman appears to be unfazed by all the noise surrounding the India-Bangladesh T20 World Cup row. Bangladesh have refused to send their team to India for the upcoming ICC event.

No need for split coaching in Indian cricket at the moment: Harbhajan Former India cricketer Harbhajan Singh does not want split coaching in the Indian team. Harbhajan has backed Gautam Gambhir as questions continue to loom about his red-ball credentials.

Ole back at Manchester United? Solskjaer seen in amidst return rumours Amist Manchester United return rumours, Ole Gunnar Solksjaer was spotted in Cheshire on Tuesday, January 6. Solksjaer is considered to be United's top target for the interim manager role until the end of the season.

Controversial spinner Lamichhane headlines Nepal's 15-member T20 World Cup squad Sandeep Lamichhane will be spearheading Nepal's spin attack as they reveal the 15-member squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026 on Tuesday, January 6. Rohit Paudel will be leading the side with Dipendra Airee acting as his deputy.

ICC unmoved, set to request Bangladesh to play T20 World Cup in India: Report The International Cricket Council wants Bangladesh to play its group-stage matches in India. The international body was expected to host a meeting with the Bangladesh Cricket Board on Tuesday.

Pep Guardiola makes Manchester United claim after Amorim sacking: Close to Arsenal Pep Guardiola has claimed that Manchester United could have been close to Arsenal in the Premier League title race had a handful of results gone their way before the club sacked manager Ruben Amorim.

ISL to start from February 14, all clubs to participate: Sports Minister Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya announced on Tuesday that the Indian Super League (ISL), which had been put on hold due to the lack of a commercial partner, will resume from February 14.

Watch: Rohit Sharma continues no vada pav policy, declines fan's offer in Mumbai Rohit Sharma has rejected his favourite vada pav once again as he declined the offer from a fan politely while training ahead of the India vs New Zealand ODIs in Mumbai on Tuesday, January 6.

Pant's lack of ODI game time irks Ex-India batter: He is a generational talent Former cricketer Aakash Chopra has raised concerns about the Indian selectors' handling of wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant in the ODI squad, pointing out the lack of playing opportunities for Pant since 2024 despite his inclusion against New Zealand.

Pretty s**t stat: Travis Head turns press room into comedy club in SydneyAshes 2025-26: Travis Head lit up the SCG with a breathtaking century and then carried the entertainment into the press room, delighting journalists with humour, honesty and effortless charm after another Ashes masterclass.

India has a doping problem: Full list of athletes who tested positive in 2025India has a doping problem. Several athletes across disciplines were suspended after testing positive for banned substances last year. Here's the full list.

Sri Lanka vs Pakistan T20I series Live Streaming: Squads and all you need to knowThe Sri Lanka–Pakistan T20I series in Dambulla from January 7–11 serves as a key World Cup 2026 warm-up, allowing both teams to test combinations, assess depth and fine-tune strategies in familiar conditions.

Brendon McCullum may quit as coach if England give post-Ashes ultimatum: ReportBrendon McCullum may reportedly quit as the coach of the England and Wales cricket board gives him an ultimatum to make sweeping changes to the team's environment and culture. The ECB review has started on England's poor Ashes series.

Solskjaer considered for shock Manchester United return after Amorim sacking: ReportOle Gunnar Solskjaer is reportedly being considered for a return as Manchester United's caretaker head coach following the sacking of Ruben Amorim, as the club searches for stability during a turbulent period.

Mustafizur Rahman IPL snub: Bangladesh fans claim KKR have lost followersThe Mustafizur Rahman controversy has triggered a backlash from Bangladesh, with fans claiming to have boycotted KKR, the government banning IPL telecasts, and the BCB refusing to play T20 World Cup matches in India while seeking ICC intervention.

Once hailed as swift as MS Dhoni, England great joins Gujarat Giants as fielding coachEngland legend Sarah Taylor joins Gujarat Giants as fielding coach for the Women's Premier League 2026, bringing world-class experience to strengthen the team's fielding and overall performance.

Chelsea appoint Liam Rosenior as new head coach, given lengthy contractChelsea have confirmed the appointment of Liam Rosenior as their new head coach, replacing Enzo Maresca. Rosenior impressed everyone with his work with RC Strasbourg in France and joins the Blues on a lengthy contract.

Shubman Gill trolled after Vijay Hazare Trophy failure vs Goa: Flat track bullyIndia ODI captain Shubman Gill was mercilessly trolled after failing on his return to domestic cricket. Playing against Goa, Gill was dismissed for only 11 runs by Vasuki Koushik.

Indian women would be hard to beat in future: Ashleigh Gardner reveals scary prospectAustralia all-rounder Ashleigh Gardner revealed that the Indian women's team would be hard to beat in the near future as their meteoric rise continued with the Women's World Cup win at home last year.

Tactician Meg Lanning runs into uncharted territory to change UP Warriorz fateFormer Australian captain Meg Lanning has a huge task in hand as UP Warriorz look to recover and make an impact in the Women's Premier League (WPL) after finishing at the bottom of the table last time around.

Malaysia Open: 20-year-old Ayush Shetty knocks out home favourite in 1st RoundMalaysia Open 2026: 20-year-old Ayush Shetty defeated local favourite Lee Zii Jia 21-12, 21-17 in the first round of men's singles at the Super 1000 event in Kuala Lumpur. He joined Lakshya Sen in the second round of the season-opening event.

Virat Kohli walked away from Tests, didn't try to fix his issues: ManjrekarSanjay Manjrekar has expressed sadness over Virat Kohli's decision to retire from Test cricket early. He believes Kohli could have fought harder to regain form as his contemporaries continue to score heavily in the longest format.

Joe Root debate: Is England star the greatest Test cricketer of the current era?Ashes, AUS vs ENG: Joe Root's composed century in the fifth Test at the Sydney Cricket Ground, backed by unmatched consistency and conversions, cements him as the standout Test batter of the current era.

How Kapil Dev changed Indian cricket even before the 1983 World CupLong before the 1983 World Cup triumph, Kapil Dev had already emerged as one of India's most entertaining cricketers, redefining fast bowling, all-round excellence and fearless leadership across formats.

Bangladesh Pacer Mustafizur Denied Rs 9.2 Crore Compensation After KKR ReleaseIn this special report, India Today's Nitin Srivastava details the controversy surrounding Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman's release by Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR). The BCCI directed KKR to release Mustafizur, who was bought for ₹9.2 crore, citing 'developments all around' amid diplomatic tensions. Srivastava explains that the pacer is unlikely to receive any financial compensation as he did not attend the training camp or play any matches. The segment also touches on the criticism faced by KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan and the reaction from Bangladesh.

Liam Rosenior confirms he will be Chelsea's new manager: I have agreed verballyRacing Strasbourg head coach Liam Rosenior has confirmed that he is set to become the new manager of Chelsea, revealing that a verbal agreement has been reached following talks with the Premier League club.

Deepti Sharma dethroned as Annabel Sutherland becomes new No. 1 T20 bowlerAustralia all-rounder Annabel Sutherland has replaced Indian spinner Deepti Sharma at the top of the ICC Women's T20I Bowling Rankings in the latest update released on Tuesday.

Vijay Hazare Trophy: Iyer slams 82 on return to pitch after spleen injuryShreyas Iyer returned to competitive cricket with a brilliant 82-run innings in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. Iyer has been selected in the India squad for the New Zealand ODI series, where his participation is subject to him regaining full match fitness.

Aashayein khile dil ki: Jemimah stuns fans with rocking performance at Reliance eventJemimah Rodrigues charmed fans with a soulful 'Aashayein' performance at a Reliance Foundation event before turning focus to her new role as Delhi Capitals skipper in Women's Premier League 2026.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
